definition: to confine/to lock up/to pen in
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to encircle/to go around/to circle/to beat about the bush
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush

sentences.english: Accessibly several different versions, oriented to different circle of tasks.
sentences.chinese: 通俗易懂的几个不同版本，面向不同圈子的任务。

sentences.english: Mrs. Archer and her group felt a certain timidity concerning these persons.
sentences.chinese: 对这班人阿切尔夫人和她那个小圈子怀有某种畏怯感。

sentences.english: Don't beat around bush. Just give it to me straight.
sentences.chinese: 别兜圈子了，对我有话直说吧。

sentences.english: Mount Unzen is one of more than a thousand active volcanoes that circle the Pacific Ocean.
sentences.chinese: 云仙岳是千余座活火山这个圈子太平洋之一。

sentences.english: You can restrict messages, friend requests, comments, group invitations and instant messages.
sentences.chinese: 你可以限制留言，交友请求，邀请圈子和即时信息。

sentences.english: The horse is running round the field.
In New England, if we except a circle of Bostonians, this has been especially true.
sentences.chinese: 在新英格兰，撇开波士顿人的圈子不论。

sentences.english: The aircraft circled around over the landing strip …
sentences.chinese: 飞机在着陆跑道上空兜圈子。

sentences.english: Find people that interest you and invite them to join your network.
sentences.chinese: 寻找您感兴趣的人员并邀请他们加入到您的圈子。

sentences.english: When I first moved to Winnipeg, I had to completely build a new social circle.
sentences.chinese: 刚搬到温尼伯市时，我必须构建一个完整的社交圈子。

sentences.english: The circle seemed to portray the deliberations of the young man.
sentences.chinese: 绕圈子似乎在描绘年轻人的深思熟虑。

sentences.english: It's as if time had turned around and we were back at the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 时光好象在打圈子，我们又回到了开始的时候。

sentences.english: Can you discuss that, and what your role is in that small circle?
sentences.chinese: 你能谈谈吗，还有你在这个小圈子里是什么角色？

sentences.english: Renting is more popular than ever, even among the wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 即使是在富人圈子里，租房之风也空前盛行。

sentences.english: She married the right man, man out of her own circle.
sentences.chinese: 她嫁给了一个她那个圈子里很好的男人。

sentences.english: She was a shady figure in the Dublin underworld.
sentences.chinese: 她是都柏林犯罪圈子中的可疑人物。

definition: to confine/to lock up/to pen in
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
mixed in as part of a community/hiding one's identity/occupying a position while not deserving it
the eight divinatory trigrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]/gossip/gossipy
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to search (a place)/to search (a database etc)
